gloss: Half the effort, double the results.
teaser: Ever wondered how to achieve more with less effort? Let’s dive into today’s 成语!
script: Welcome to Chengyu Bites — your quick summary on Chinese 成语. Ever wondered how to achieve more with less effort? Let’s dive into today’s 成语! [break 1s] The phrase is: 事半功倍, shì bàn gōng bèi. [break 0.5s] 事 (shì) - matter or affair, [break 0.5s] 半 (bàn) - half, [break 0.5s] 功 (gōng) - effort or achievement, [break 0.5s] 倍 (bèi) - times or fold. [break 1s] The full idiom is 事半功倍, which literally means 'half the effort, double the results,' and figuratively suggests that with smart work, you can achieve more. [break 1s] Here’s the story behind it: [break 1.5s] This idiom originates from an ancient Chinese text that discusses the importance of efficiency. It emphasizes that by using the right methods and strategies, one can accomplish tasks more effectively. This concept has been valued in Chinese culture for centuries, encouraging people to work smarter, not harder. [break 1.5s] Example one: 他用事半功倍的方法完成了项目。 [break 1s] He completed the project using a method that was half the effort but double the results. [break 1s] Example two: 学习要事半功倍，不能只靠死记硬背。 [break 1s] Learning should be efficient; you can't just rely on rote memorization. [break 1s] Example three: 通过合理的时间管理，我们可以实现事半功倍的效果。 [break 1s] With proper time management, we can achieve results that are double the effort put in. [break 1s] So, remember 事半功倍 means 'half the effort, double the results.' Thank you for listening to Chengyu Bites! See you next time for another idiom. [break 1s]
